reviewText:
I honestly thought other reviewers were being a little too harsh and demanding in their comments, and as a big fan of Double Fine, I thought I'd still enjoy this game. Boy was I wrong.

It looks amazing, and the idea is fantastic! But the game IS indeed unfinished. It offers no goals that keep you excited about what's next, such as unlocking new rooms and items as you progress. There's no campaign, no mission, nothing. You get what you get at the start of the game (and it is ridiculously little), and that's that. After about 2-3 hours, you've gotten a taste of what the game is, but meanwhile, you've had to deal with tons of bugs, stupid AI characters that block themselves in whenever you try to build something, mechanics that won't fix your broken machines, fires that will forever burn even though they've been put out, sparks that fly everywhere even when you rebuild the broken doors... It's just really annoying.

Such a shame. This game could have been amazing. It certainly looks the part!

TL;DR
- Not worth $20
- Not even worth half that
- Boring and incredibly lacking in content
- Go play something else, like old school Theme Hospital for example... *sigh* I miss those days.
voteText: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
(I wanted to redo my review for a better viewpoint and whatnot. This review also comes from someone who played early access, and played post realease)

I can say, that the concept for this game was great! A spacebase that half the time acts nicely, and runs like clockwork, then raiders show up and wreck s**t up. I was really excited when I heard this, and boughtit in early access. When I bought the game, I thought it was doing quite well for an early access game, and I enjoyed it!

But, there were some signs that the game development was having problems. Updates, weeks and sometimes months apart. And these updates were adding barely anything to the game, and even bug fixing was quite slow. The AI, was and still is unbearable. And will do stupid things. The variety of things you can build in specific rooms is extremly limited.

And, of course, this game was pushed out the door, being realeased way to early. An example, was that your station's power supply. That was not even a factor until the update before realease. Reasearch was the same story, the update before realease. And the tech tree is pretty much worthless in the game anyway. If you looked at the planned features for this game, they say that they were possible ideas, but some of the content they said were possible are needed in this kind of game!

My last words on this are, Don't buy this piece of ♥♥♥♥, in fact, don't buy any sort of thing from Double Fine, unless you can at least make sure that production will finish on the game fully

2/10- Fun for an hour or two, but no storyline, not enought content, and lack of any new things happening after half an hour of gameplay, makes this game awful. Classic example of why you should buy early access games unless they are dirt cheap and you like the idea, or if you have a undying love in your heart for a concept that someone using early access is trying to make.

Long story short- STAY AWAY!!!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Frankly, avoid this game.

I bought into the Early Access alpha version of this game because at the time I looked forward to the initial concept of the game as advertised and had faith in Double Fine, developers notorious for several well-received cult classics including Psychonauts and Brutal Legend (controversial but in my opinion a very underrated game), to complete it on-schedule and more or less in a finished form of the advertised concept.

It seems apparent, that with the sudden push from 0.6 Alpha to 1.0 Release, that this will not be the case. From my experience, the game as-is is interesting but very buggy and sorely lacking in features. The base-building is somewhat simplistic, which, while partially due to the visual format of the game, is not enough to keep me interested in it. The AI for both friendly and enemy NPCs is very glitchy, hard to control and frankly suicidal at times. The user interface is clunky, incomplete and apparently designed for touchscreen support at the expense of UI size. The game has fullscreen support bugs, occasionally crashes without warning and lacks a tutorial.

Resource management is laughably simplistic, relying simply on the presence of basic station necessities (walls, furniture, life support, matter refineries, etc.) and NPCs in enough of a quantity to satisfy some invisible mysterious ratio (with the exception of oxygen/life support-based crew capacity, this is prominently displayed on the user interface, a very good thing).

The long-term gameplay suffers when you take into account that there's a very finite amount of natural resources (called matter in-game) with which to build infrastructure and feed NPCs, which means you generally have to rely on proper choice of starting location in order to ultimately dictate how long you'll be able to keep your base going and how much harassment from raiders you'll get. In my opinion there's something wrong with the game when raider attacks are a promising sign of long-term survival after a certain point.

If derelicts are part of your chosen starting location, then, yes, ostensibly I could see you breaking them down for matter for self-preservation, perhaps indefinitely, but I have yet to succeed at this, either due to a lack of experience or simply because it takes too long, I don't actually know personally because it's completely up to the AI-controlled crew NPCs to do this after the order's given.

NPC deaths (which happen often, due to only security officers being capable of self-defense if I recall correctly, and hardly capable at that) affect nearly the entire crew's morale directly and drastically and how useful they are in performing their tasks. This is apparently impossible to remedy (again, I may be mistaken).

Even beyond these problems there's just not all that much to do, just survive as long as possible and assign new/current NPCs to station tasks and watch them utterly fail to perform them. Or starve to death because they can't find their way to the cantina because they're depressed and oversleeping. Or open up an interior door into a hallway with an oxygen leak and asphyxiate. Or catch themselves on fire and avoid several nearby, conveniently placed fire extinguishers, relying on other NPCs to actually see that their compadres are on a painful path from the psych ward to the burn ward and put them out. This all creates a bit of a death spiral for the NPCs, which is an interesting but infuriating and uncontrollable part of Dwarf Fortress, a game which Spacebase: DF-9's apparently inspired by.

To Double Fine's benefit, survival was one of the game's main selling points. Sadly, in its current state and potential state when released in 1.0, this may be impossible, or indeed, utterly futile and pointless to attempt from the outset.

Hopefully the game will improve once mod support" is implemented
date:
but it shouldn't take mod support for basic implementation of features and bugfixes to occur.

It seems like the general consensus is that the game has been abandoned. I'd disagree with that verdict and give the developers the benefit of the doubt if it weren't so d**n obvious.

Double Fine
recommended: you know better than this. "Big Ambitions
hoursPlayed: Broken Dreams" indeed."

reviewText:
(I wanted to redo my review for a better viewpoint and whatnot. This review also comes from someone who played early access, and played post realease)

I can say, that the concept for this game was great! A spacebase that half the time acts nicely, and runs like clockwork, then raiders show up and wreck s**t up. I was really excited when I heard this, and boughtit in early access. When I bought the game, I thought it was doing quite well for an early access game, and I enjoyed it!

But, there were some signs that the game development was having problems. Updates, weeks and sometimes months apart. And these updates were adding barely anything to the game, and even bug fixing was quite slow. The AI, was and still is unbearable. And will do stupid things. The variety of things you can build in specific rooms is extremly limited.

And, of course, this game was pushed out the door, being realeased way to early. An example, was that your station's power supply. That was not even a factor until the update before realease. Reasearch was the same story, the update before realease. And the tech tree is pretty much worthless in the game anyway. If you looked at the planned features for this game, they say that they were possible ideas, but some of the content they said were possible are needed in this kind of game!

My last words on this are, Don't buy this piece of ♥♥♥♥, in fact, don't buy any sort of thing from Double Fine, unless you can at least make sure that production will finish on the game fully

2/10- Fun for an hour or two, but no storyline, not enought content, and lack of any new things happening after half an hour of gameplay, makes this game awful. Classic example of why you should buy early access games unless they are dirt cheap and you like the idea, or if you have a undying love in your heart for a concept that someone using early access is trying to make.

Long story short- STAY AWAY!!!

reviewText:
The game itself had so much promise, and due to the mismanagement of the dev team and lack of experience with the Early access model they have essentially decided to early realease the main 1.0 without many of the features promised. It's kind of like buying an all inclusive holiday including hotel and beach views, and then getting there and finding you have a window facing a wall and a room smelling of fish.

I understand where Double fine are coming from but in any other industry, if you preorder something and it doesn't deliver as promised, then trading standards get involved. As a consumer I don't think Early Access is providing enough protection agains fails like this. My question is this...why aren't Double Fine taking the hit for not delivering? Shouldn't they be made to finish this game to the extent of the content they advertised? Surely that is false advertising...and yes, I know they put something like all features are prospective and not necessarily in the game" but in that case there need to be more rules goeverning Early access so we don't keep getting burned! :S

Still to find a mod that can fix the annoying gameplay in this game. The AI just feels broken and the game becomes unplayable at later stages. Updated Mar 2015."

솔직히 2013년도 후반기정도에 계속 스팀 상점 특집탭에 메인으로 떠있어서 우와.... 우주정거장이라.... 잼겠네... 거기다 심즈같은 삘도있다고해서 샀는데 이런게임은 처음본다. 얼리엑세스 라고는 하지만 이게 뭐냐.
프리즌 아키텍트 같은 건축물을 바라시는 분들은 차라리 스페이스 엔지니어를 사세요

이게임이 왜 별로냐

우주, 정거장, 개개인의 요구나 기분 같은것을 표현한것은 아주 좋은 아이디어임
그러나
메테오 스트라이크 쳐맞을때 혹은 누군가 누구를 폭행하거나 죽이고 있을때, 아니면 일좀하라고 시키고 싶을때, 전혀 컨트롤 할수 없음
심즈와 우주 정거장의 결합이라는 말
개소리다 리얼 우주 정거장만 있고 초반에 설명도 거지같다
베이스 씨드로 부터 파워가 나온다 하지만 스테이션에 연결되어있지 않다.  연결되었나 확인하라 라는 메세지는 뜨지만 어떻게 연결을 해야하는지도 안알려준다. 내가 봤을때 베이스 씨드에 플로어 하나 깔고, 그 옆에 그냥 건물지으면 파워 공급된다. 일단 이런것도 안알려주고, 제일 거지 같은것은 컨트롤 ㅈ 병맛 아주 씹병맛
심즈는 이 새퀴가 재미가 1퍼가 남았든 뭐든 명령을 할수 있다. 하지만 이겜은 아예 자율신경계다 우주비행사놈이 하고 싶을때 일하고 놀고싶을때 그냥 쳐 논다.
그로인해 나오는 병맛
1. 시큐리티로 듀티 지정해놓고 우주비행사끼리 싸울때 다른애랑 대화하던 중이어서 전혀 신경안쓴다
2. 일 한번하고 '반드시' 놀아야함
3. 메테오 스트라이크 맞아서 건축가 녀석보고 이 상태 안좋은 산소 발생기 띄고 다시 달아라 (다시 달면 상태 100퍼임) 라는 명령을 내림
3-1. 떼어내긴 아주 기가막히게 떼어냄
3-2. 14인이 살던곳에 15인 수용량의 산소발생기가 있었음 그중 하나를 떼서 12인의 산소분만 발생됨(개당 3인의 산소가 발생)
3-3. 산소가 부족해지기 시작하고 사람들이 갑자기 모두 숨을곳을 찾고있음 상태가 됨
3-4. 건축가 이 씹빨놈도 산소찾아 빙하타러 내려감(이 개새끼가 그냥 산소발생기 쌔거 달면 될걸 AI조또 개 병신이라 그냥 seeking for cover상태로 그냥 뛰어다니기만 함)
3-5. 산소부족으로 다 뒤짐^오^

컨트롤 안되서 ㅈ빡치는 건 이정도고 더 빡치는건
1. Mining을 해야되는데 자원 20-35같이 Really High 인 지역이 아니면 자원 ㅈㄴ 없음 High여도 엄청 없음
2. 위에 말한대로 컨트롤 안되는게 파워 공급도 따로 컨트롤이 안되는거라 리엑터 새거 달고 베이스 씨드 해체하면 파워공급안되서 질식사 할 때도 있음
3. Airlock좀 병맛이라 seeking for cover상태일때 문그냥 열려서 우주로 빨려나가기도함
4. 연구 오질나게 느려터짐
5. 테크니션도 기계상태나 똑띠 볼것이지 애새끼들이랑 대화하느라고 기계 체크도 안함
6. 아니 시발 대체 빌더 하기 싫다고 빨간얼굴에 인상 팍쓴새끼가 빌더 스킬 3개는 나보고 어쩌란거냐 뭐 우주에 신분이라도 생겼냐 평생 노예로 빌더만 하다와서 빌더 스킬은 만땅인데 빌더하기 싫은겨?
7. 간혹가다가 해적들이 기지에 지네 함선 도킹하고 공격할때 있는데 해적 다 처리하고 이 함선을 vaporize나 teardown시키면 간혹 안에서 뻗튕기고 안나오는 시발놈들 있음 그러다가 도킹부분 먼저 해체하면 ㅈㄴ ㅈ같음
8. 메테오가 아주 ㅈ ♥♥♥♥♥♥임 위에서 말한 자원없다고 한 부분이 문제인게 자원이 많은데는 메테오가 ㅈㄴ 자주옴 나 3연타 맞고 기계 병신되서 산소발생기 갈다가 위에꼴 난거임 근데 또 메테오 피할라고 High만 해도 우주 정거장(씨드가 중심임)에서 ㅈㄴ 먼곳에 아주 찔끔 자원있음
9. 자원이 오질나게 쳐 비쌈
10. 내가봐도 우주비행사가 머무르고 싶다는 메세지 거절문구가 ㅈㄴ 병맛임 오죽하면 거절당한애가 그정도로 과장할 필요없다 이 개새끼야 그냥 싫다고 해라 라고함(뭐라 하냐면 어.... 음... 미안한데 넌 지금 1357번째 입주 대기자야 이러고 있음)

아주 ♥♥♥♥♥♥ ㅈ같은 개새끼 게임임 개발자가 대가리가 있으면 지금 알파6가 아니라 알파 13은 나와야지 최소한 프리즌 아키텍트가 괜히 ㅈㄴ 사랑받는줄 아냐 어? 페이데이2가 괜히 광빠가 생기는줄알아? 업뎃을 자주자주 해야될거 아니야 이 개♥♥♥♥♥♥ 호로새끼들아

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I remember first encountering this game during Amnesia Fortnight 2012, Double Fine's crowdfunded event in which they put out a series of rapid prototypes to test out a bunch of different game ideas.

I'm going to bottom line this for you: the game hasn't evolved significantly beyond what was originally shown off as a rapid development prototype nearly two years ago. Updates are slow and add to the backend with new features that increase complexity, but don't actually add content or meaningful gameplay in any way. Worse, the developers have completely removed the Future development plans" backlog from their website with no explanation. This is to say nothing of the numerous game breaking bugs and brick-dumb AI which have survived for release after release.

And yet I could deal with all of that if the game were fun to play... but it's not. Games like its inspiration
recommended: are fun because of their emergent gameplay - the stories and situations which unfold around you are completely unique to each playthrough
hoursPlayed: creating a different experience every time you play. This frankly isn't true in DF-9
voteText: at least in its current state. Fire up the game and start on a random map and you'll have built and encountered everything there is to see in around an hour; there's no point in starting a new game since the same story unfolds every time.\n"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

At the moment, don't buy the game. That doesn't mean don't pay attention to it, just don't put your money into it at this juncture.  The AI pathing is questionable at best (space requirments for individuals to navigate around larger items within the base is different considering the dimensions available). AI would rather sleep then do a job you have assigned them to; AI get's stuck within a structure with no doors or other forms of escape after you ask them to build it.

Way too many individuals ask to your base than you are obviously ready for (I had over 10 within the first 15-20 minutes in one play attempt). The mechanics are fantastic. I will personaly be continuing to attempt playing this game, but can't recommend it to others that haven't already paid for the alpha.

Why?
Specifically the AI doesn't seem capable of managing the new functionality. Also the threat system is totally broken. For some reason in my extreme low" hostility sector I get constant pirate raids (and I do mean constant. Like... 30 seconds after beating the last one there's another).  Or a meteor impact. The "game" (if one can call it that anymore) has gone from a space colony sim to a constant crisis.

But more fundamentally... the brig system doesn't work right
date: nor the tantrum system. So first the brig system: enemies can often get "subdued" where they just stand there endlessly until they starve. If you have a brig
recommended: you can store them there instead. There doesn't appear to be any reason to do this that I can see. There is no benefit. Its preferable to let enemies starve
hoursPlayed: especially because sometimes captured enemies lose their "subdued" flag and simply walk out of the brig to shoot up your base again. Seriously... WHAT IS THE POINT? Also... did you guys even test this release?? Its almost entirely unplayable.\n\nOkay so now to the tantrum system. Colonists can get freaked out

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Spacebase DF-9 looked quite interesting, from the Dwarf Fortress-esque room management to the quirky characters and random event system.  Unfortunately, it hasn't had a significant content upgrade since I initially saw it months ago on an Evening with Sips episode or short series.  What is in this game is a wide gamut of bugs combined with sheer stupidity when it comes to the AI, arguably the most important part of the game, and they screwed it up.

Not being able to build rooms, place objects, or cancel construction orders without having to move the camera around until the game sees fit to finally let your commands go through was the most common bug, and it persisted in being terrible from the moment I tried to start building a base to my eventual giving up on the game.  Random events seem to pull from a pool of maybe 5 different things, the most frequent of which was a ship encounter that featured a squeal along the lines of EEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE!!!!! WE FINALLY FOUND YOU!!!!!!!!  WE'RE COMING ABOARD THIS INSTANT!" to which no matter whether you select to allow them on or not
date: you are forced to take on additional crew members
recommended: all of which will be more of a liability than a help due to their universally crap skills.  This will culminate in your base having to constantly expand its oxygen suppliers and eventually even building a second reactor

솔직히 2013년도 후반기정도에 계속 스팀 상점 특집탭에 메인으로 떠있어서 우와.... 우주정거장이라.... 잼겠네... 거기다 심즈같은 삘도있다고해서 샀는데 이런게임은 처음본다. 얼리엑세스 라고는 하지만 이게 뭐냐.
프리즌 아키텍트 같은 건축물을 바라시는 분들은 차라리 스페이스 엔지니어를 사세요

이게임이 왜 별로냐

우주, 정거장, 개개인의 요구나 기분 같은것을 표현한것은 아주 좋은 아이디어임
그러나
메테오 스트라이크 쳐맞을때 혹은 누군가 누구를 폭행하거나 죽이고 있을때, 아니면 일좀하라고 시키고 싶을때, 전혀 컨트롤 할수 없음
심즈와 우주 정거장의 결합이라는 말
개소리다 리얼 우주 정거장만 있고 초반에 설명도 거지같다
베이스 씨드로 부터 파워가 나온다 하지만 스테이션에 연결되어있지 않다.  연결되었나 확인하라 라는 메세지는 뜨지만 어떻게 연결을 해야하는지도 안알려준다. 내가 봤을때 베이스 씨드에 플로어 하나 깔고, 그 옆에 그냥 건물지으면 파워 공급된다. 일단 이런것도 안알려주고, 제일 거지 같은것은 컨트롤 ㅈ 병맛 아주 씹병맛
심즈는 이 새퀴가 재미가 1퍼가 남았든 뭐든 명령을 할수 있다. 하지만 이겜은 아예 자율신경계다 우주비행사놈이 하고 싶을때 일하고 놀고싶을때 그냥 쳐 논다.
그로인해 나오는 병맛
1. 시큐리티로 듀티 지정해놓고 우주비행사끼리 싸울때 다른애랑 대화하던 중이어서 전혀 신경안쓴다
2. 일 한번하고 '반드시' 놀아야함
3. 메테오 스트라이크 맞아서 건축가 녀석보고 이 상태 안좋은 산소 발생기 띄고 다시 달아라 (다시 달면 상태 100퍼임) 라는 명령을 내림
3-1. 떼어내긴 아주 기가막히게 떼어냄
3-2. 14인이 살던곳에 15인 수용량의 산소발생기가 있었음 그중 하나를 떼서 12인의 산소분만 발생됨(개당 3인의 산소가 발생)
3-3. 산소가 부족해지기 시작하고 사람들이 갑자기 모두 숨을곳을 찾고있음 상태가 됨
3-4. 건축가 이 씹빨놈도 산소찾아 빙하타러 내려감(이 개새끼가 그냥 산소발생기 쌔거 달면 될걸 AI조또 개 병신이라 그냥 seeking for cover상태로 그냥 뛰어다니기만 함)
3-5. 산소부족으로 다 뒤짐^오^

컨트롤 안되서 ㅈ빡치는 건 이정도고 더 빡치는건
1. Mining을 해야되는데 자원 20-35같이 Really High 인 지역이 아니면 자원 ㅈㄴ 없음 High여도 엄청 없음
2. 위에 말한대로 컨트롤 안되는게 파워 공급도 따로 컨트롤이 안되는거라 리엑터 새거 달고 베이스 씨드 해체하면 파워공급안되서 질식사 할 때도 있음
3. Airlock좀 병맛이라 seeking for cover상태일때 문그냥 열려서 우주로 빨려나가기도함
4. 연구 오질나게 느려터짐
5. 테크니션도 기계상태나 똑띠 볼것이지 애새끼들이랑 대화하느라고 기계 체크도 안함
6. 아니 시발 대체 빌더 하기 싫다고 빨간얼굴에 인상 팍쓴새끼가 빌더 스킬 3개는 나보고 어쩌란거냐 뭐 우주에 신분이라도 생겼냐 평생 노예로 빌더만 하다와서 빌더 스킬은 만땅인데 빌더하기 싫은겨?
7. 간혹가다가 해적들이 기지에 지네 함선 도킹하고 공격할때 있는데 해적 다 처리하고 이 함선을 vaporize나 teardown시키면 간혹 안에서 뻗튕기고 안나오는 시발놈들 있음 그러다가 도킹부분 먼저 해체하면 ㅈㄴ ㅈ같음
8. 메테오가 아주 ㅈ ♥♥♥♥♥♥임 위에서 말한 자원없다고 한 부분이 문제인게 자원이 많은데는 메테오가 ㅈㄴ 자주옴 나 3연타 맞고 기계 병신되서 산소발생기 갈다가 위에꼴 난거임 근데 또 메테오 피할라고 High만 해도 우주 정거장(씨드가 중심임)에서 ㅈㄴ 먼곳에 아주 찔끔 자원있음
9. 자원이 오질나게 쳐 비쌈
10. 내가봐도 우주비행사가 머무르고 싶다는 메세지 거절문구가 ㅈㄴ 병맛임 오죽하면 거절당한애가 그정도로 과장할 필요없다 이 개새끼야 그냥 싫다고 해라 라고함(뭐라 하냐면 어.... 음... 미안한데 넌 지금 1357번째 입주 대기자야 이러고 있음)

아주 ♥♥♥♥♥♥ ㅈ같은 개새끼 게임임 개발자가 대가리가 있으면 지금 알파6가 아니라 알파 13은 나와야지 최소한 프리즌 아키텍트가 괜히 ㅈㄴ 사랑받는줄 아냐 어? 페이데이2가 괜히 광빠가 생기는줄알아? 업뎃을 자주자주 해야될거 아니야 이 개♥♥♥♥♥♥ 호로새끼들아

이 좆같은 리뷰읽어줘서 고맙다 한글로 된 리뷰 없어서 몇자 적는다

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Spacebase DF-9 really has great potential. And I cannot say that I squandered 9 hours of my life by playing the game, in fact I even had a good time. However, I have already exhausted all game play possibilites and all the content within that time - twice. Thus, it is highly disappointing that the developers decided to quit developing the game any further and have hitted the emergency exit button as of financial miscalculations by jumping from Alpha to full release by adding a tutorial, objectives and granting access to the source code (which is actually nice but even this cannot whitewash the feeling that I have paid money for a broken promise).

If you like management simulations (and space), I would recommend it only if it is on sale for 5-10€ / 10$. As for 23€ [Price of Early Access Version in October '14] I do not recommend buying DF-9.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is an example of how bad the Early Access model can be. The plan of the developer, Double Fine, was to fund the development from the start with the sales of the (prototype of the) game, reduce drastically their initial investment, and hope that their good name and promises on how they imagined the final game were enough to attract customers. The 'experiment' failed completely because most people interested in the game were holding their purchase to see how the developers were updating the game. It became a self-fulfilling prophecy of failure, in which due to the lack of sales the developers were not able to assign more efforts to the game and, at the same time, exactly that slow development was the reason behind the low amount of sales.

To come to an end to this grotesque scenario, Double Fine decided to stop the development and release the game as it is currently. The game is still in its bare bones and the experience is lacking in many areas, but they will create a tutorial, tools to create mods, and hope for a nonexistent community to continue its development.

About me: I've been a big fan of Double Fine games during the last years. I loved Psychonauts and Monkey Island, funded the Kickstarter of Broken Age and enjoyed other games like Costume Quest, Stacking or The Cave. This is the first dissapointment. It has destroyed the trust that I had in DF and, in the future, I will behave with them as if they are an unknown dev without credentials. I will investigate with caution about their games before buying or I will simply ignore them. Also, I won't buy any Early Access games and advice others to do the same.

Early Access Review

I was really excited about this game, I always wanted to get into Dwarf Fortress but I can't deal with the obtuse interface, so this looked great. As it is, you should buy Clockwork Empires instead.

I'm really disappointed that devs are abandoning this. I understand why, but they gave no indication that the game was running over budget before they suddenly pulled the plug. reviewText:
Early Access Review

The game has a UI that's pleasing to work with, and it carried big ideas and ambition. But the devs have abandoned it, dumping all the goals and going to 1.0 and asking the modders to carry it. Apparrently they've tried to emulate Dwarf Fortress while forgetting DF is developed by 2 people over the course of years and a major cult following to support them both.

The best hope is that it goes open source and that modders do in fact save it, like with Cataclysm: DDA. But I don't think that will happen.

The game itself is amusing and fun for about an hour, but it's mired with game breaking bugs, and the difficulty curve is just... An endless swarm of raiders even on peaceful maps? Space junk just constantly hailing down on you? The fact 2 raiders can slaughter an entire base?

The bugs aren't even amusing like many in Dwarf Fortress. They're not ridiculous, they're just frustrating.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

A great concept squandered by mismanagement. The game is buggy and has extremely shallow gameplay.

I played the early prototype of this game that I got with HumbleBundle's Amnesia Fortnight bundle, I liked it the concept but it was clearly in very early stages. Sadly, what we have now is not very different, even though the graphics have been improved.

DoubleFine was looking to cash in on games like Prison Architect. They even said as much themselves. They got investors involved (and successfully paid them off with the huge volume of Steam customers) and then when it wasn't as hot as they wanted, they cut development, did some more sales to lure in a few more suckers and then pulled the plug. In that order.

Most of the people who hadn't bought it yet were waiting for beta or full release, but DoubleFine wanted to make all their money up front. Their business model for this title depended on it, and it is a flawed and presumptuous business model that screws over the consumer.

Obviously

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I remember first encountering this game during Amnesia Fortnight 2012, Double Fine's crowdfunded event in which they put out a series of rapid prototypes to test out a bunch of different game ideas.

I'm going to bottom line this for you: the game hasn't evolved significantly beyond what was originally shown off as a rapid development prototype nearly two years ago. Updates are slow and add to the backend with new features that increase complexity, but don't actually add content or meaningful gameplay in any way. Worse, the developers have completely removed the Future development plans" backlog from their website with no explanation. This is to say nothing of the numerous game breaking bugs and brick-dumb AI which have survived for release after release.

And yet I could deal with all of that if the game were fun to play... but it's not. Games like its inspiration
recommended: are fun because of their emergent gameplay - the stories and situations which unfold around you are completely unique to each playthrough
hoursPlayed: creating a different experience every time you play. This frankly isn't true in DF-9
voteText: at least in its current state. Fire up the game and start on a random map and you'll have built and encountered everything there is to see in around an hour; there's no point in starting a new game since the same story unfolds every time.\n"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

At the moment, don't buy the game. That doesn't mean don't pay attention to it, just don't put your money into it at this juncture.  The AI pathing is questionable at best (space requirments for individuals to navigate around larger items within the base is different considering the dimensions available). AI would rather sleep then do a job you have assigned them to; AI get's stuck within a structure with no doors or other forms of escape after you ask them to build it.

Way too many individuals ask to your base than you are obviously ready for (I had over 10 within the first 15-20 minutes in one play attempt). The mechanics are fantastic. I will personaly be continuing to attempt playing this game, but can't recommend it to others that haven't already paid for the alpha.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I used to like this game. Post version 6 release, it now totally sucks.

Why?
Specifically the AI doesn't seem capable of managing the new functionality. Also the threat system is totally broken. For some reason in my extreme low" hostility sector I get constant pirate raids (and I do mean constant. Like... 30 seconds after beating the last one there's another).  Or a meteor impact. The "game" (if one can call it that anymore) has gone from a space colony sim to a constant crisis.

But more fundamentally... the brig system doesn't work right
date: nor the tantrum system. So first the brig system: enemies can often get "subdued" where they just stand there endlessly until they starve. If you have a brig
recommended: you can store them there instead. There doesn't appear to be any reason to do this that I can see. There is no benefit. Its preferable to let enemies starve
hoursPlayed: especially because sometimes captured enemies lose their "subdued" flag and simply walk out of the brig to shoot up your base again. Seriously... WHAT IS THE POINT? Also... did you guys even test this release?? Its almost entirely unplayable.\n\nOkay so now to the tantrum system. Colonists can get freaked out
voteText: wreck the place up
helpfulPercent: and fight with fellow colonists. Yet for some reason this happens to happy colonists sometimes. I suppose one could say they "just snap" or something but... once again
votesHelpful: what is the point of happiness if it doesn't do anything? Bigger problem is after a tantrumed colonist is subdued they lay there and nothing happens. Even if you have doctors on staff
votesTotal: they don't seem to treat the person like... laying there in the hallway injured. It appears that the primary role of doctors is simply corpse disposal
votesFunny: rather than anything doctor-y.\n\nIf steam had a numeric rating system
commentsCount: I'd give this 1 of 5 stars. Its really abysmal and should never have been released with the numerous game-breaking bugs. At least it was playable before."

reviewText: I really want to like this game, despite it's flaws (it's ceased dev, pre-alpha). However the end game is always the same... even if you manage to survive the constant onslaught of raiders, and space diseases, bodies persist long after death... and corpses have a detrimental affect on crew morale which can prevent crew from wanting to enter areas where these bodies are (which can prevent maintenance and production), or crew end up rioting among themselves.\nIt's a massive shame because it had a lot of potential. If the community gets behind this game and manage to produce mods to fix major issues, then I'd recommend it, but as it stands atm it's only worth a punt if it's going cheap.

reviewText:
Unfortunately, this game has been abandoned. It was at .5 before being forced to 1.0 and left to the hands of modders. Which is terrible, considering the directions this game was going before it was canned.

The name is misleading, it is less Dwarf Fortress in space, and more The Sims 2 in space with dwarf fortress elements.

reviewText:
I love the concept of this game, but for me there are too many flaws.

Raiding parties too early in the game with higher tech weaponry when you haven't got enough time to build your base to defend yourself.
The time it takes to switch jobs for characters. I had a builder and needed security quickly, my base was overrun with raiders and my builder/security just carried on building in his security suit.
The rate my citizens get peeved or bored. How do I get these ratings back up??
The lack of scenic items to raise the morale of the citizens

I'll probably keep at this game, playing it and trying out different techniques, but I can't see the level of difficulty changing in relation to raiding parties. I even placed my base in an area where it was ridiculously low for threats, but in three different games got attacked within an hour of setting up a base. I could be playing the game totally wrong, but if that's the case the tutorials need to be more informative.
voteText: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Game showed such promise. I enjoyed what the game was shaping up to be. Loved the premise and enjoyed it and watching it grow.

Unfortunately, the game is now ABANDONWARE. I do not recommend purchasing this game unless you can accept the game in an unfinished 40% state the game is in. It is fun, but there is little content, the AI is crap, and will wear out on it fast due to odd bugs and little content.

While I do understand when games have to be abandoned, with the new Early Access system, this is one many people got burned, and burned bad with. What was supposed to occur with the game, and what actually happened, were narrow. They released the game from Early Access and called that that. Did a few fast patches to shut people up about the big items and continued on their way. The dollar signs weren't big in front of Doublefine's eyes apparently, and took what they had and ran. I wish Steam would have forced their hands in this situation, but didn't, and Doublefine continues along its way like nothing happened.

I'm even more disappointed with Doublefine that they put it on sale right before they terminated development (And I can't imagine them NOT knowing they were going to can it a couple weeks before they did) and continue to sell it with no disclaimer anywhere on the Steam page that it is abandonware and no longer being worked on, AND have also put it for sale as if it's still being acknowledged.

I will not purchase another Doublefine title (or anyone who is part of their team if they move on again) in prerelease, and I am GREATLY nervous about buying a title from them ever again.

reviewText:
this game has a few too many problems for me.

1: no one ever does their jobs. the builders and the miners do their jobs, though when you tell the builders to take appart a derelict they go inside, take off their space suites, and drill a hole in the hull and kill themselves.

i got attacked by raiders and they got into my life support room and got killed, but then the room was full of dead bodies so no one wanted to go into the room to fix the oxygen recyclers. how do you get rid of dead bodies? well, the doctors are meant to come in and take them away, but whenever they enter the room they get upset by all the dead bodies and leave. THIS IS YOUR JOB! not to mention that they leave all these unconcious and injured people all over the base.

then there's the science team, there was a disease i needed them to reaserch so i assigned them to it and checked back on them about sixty minutes later and they had done NOTHING. i had a special room and everything, i double checked and they had just been standing in the hallway chatting the whole time. eventually they got to work, but people were sick and going to DIE!

the security job is nearly pointless, and what they actually do can hardly be considered security. people assigned to security patrol a small area around a single security beacon, and the only real use for this is to have them explor derelicts. i just ended up building defense turrets everywhere, but they have limited view.

1.5: you can't tell anyone what to do, so even though this room is on fire no one knows and your fusion reactors are going to burn down.

2: given how little you're actually able to do as a player, the game asks way too much of you. every five minutes it's telling you there's a new disease that needs to be researched, when instead you want to research new technology (because apparently the scientists who research dark matter also research medicine, and not the doctors), raiders seem to attack more and more frequently untill you're perpetually under attack, and the game is always telling you that, even though you have 30 reactors and twice as many oxygen recyclers than you need for your population, you don't have enough power or oxygen.

3: the AI is stupid. outside of not doing their jobs, when i got attacked by raiders the AI does nothing to avoid them. when they walk into a room and see a raider, most of them just stop and hold up their hands in fear before being shot. raiders aren't even that smart, one broke into my pub and started punching my fridge.

4: i'm not listing all the problems, i'm glad this game was so cheap when i baught it, because it's too late to get a refund.

reviewText: This game had so much potential. Go ahead and watch Scott Manly play this game on youtube. It was early access and it was shaping up to be a pretty decent Dwarf Fortress style game, but in space. Progress was made, bugs were clipped, and features added on a fairly regular basis, it had every indication that it was an early access game being developed in good faith for your investment. For whatever reason it got frozen, and released, unfinished, warts and all for the world. That's why you see so many negative reviews. This game isn't done, it makes no pretensions to being done, don't buy it unless you are fully aware what it is you are getting, and you don't have any lighters around to burn 10 bucks.

reviewText:
The idea behind DF9 is awesome. A City Builder meeting Sims in space. And that's about all I have to say to sell the game to you...

Now why I'd recommend NOT to buy it. Reasons are numerous, and most already mentioned by others and this blogpost[wildwoodgeek2.blogspot.nl] explains most of it I think.

In addition to the blogpost I'd like to add an other reason why NOT to buy DF9. Once again the AI, which just plain sucks! My personal experience with the AI sucking balls is that after a debris stike, my oxigen tanks and power supply got hit. Without power and oxigen, the whole crew starts to panic, including the whole technical team. WTF? You guys should run to the power supply and oxigen tanks to fix them instead of running around like headless chickens!

An other problem is the Sims part of the game. The people have a (hidden!) worklist of stuff they have to do. So far so good I'd say. But technical maintenance (yes once again) should have a top priority for lifesupport, but noooo..... Ocigen tanks are about to break down and they fix ...a bar stool... FFS guys get real please! Or at least let me point the Sims where they should go next instead of fully automated.

Bottom line, the idea behind DF9 is real good. Sadly the developer dropped the ball and the project, leaving us with a half-baken, bugged and dumb game :'(

reviewText:
This game is so unfinished it never even hit Beta. We have 6 Alpha releases and then Surprise! Launch party.

Development ran out of steam (heh) in early access and developers pushed the game out the door instead of completing it.

The citizen simulation is half baked, they arrive on the station with set friends and enemies and then negative or positive interactions with set friends and enemies just serves to increase or lower mood. A few promising features were half implemented but went nowhere. Others, like religion, trading, burial based on religious preferences never materialized.

The bare bones structure is there, but for a game that tried to be Dwarf Fortress (DF-9, heh), it's missing alot. One resource to collect, there won't be any traders or materials to trade for. If you look at it as a tower defense game, it can sort of work, as random waves of boarders and raiders can test your defenses and one bad hull breach can doom your entire base, but that alone isn't worth it.

Exploration and randomly generated content is nonexistant. You get hostile raiders, meteor showers, maybe 12 different canned derelict ships will appear to explore, and immigrants. Features that never materialized: Sending citizens on missions to nearby planets, traders. You'll see it all in ~2 hours.

Overall I mostly enjoyed this game on the potential that it'll get better and seeing the new content in the monthly updates that used to come. It's not really worth it as a finished product.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I can't recommend this game.

It has a lot of potential and I'd really love to see it done. I also really like the ideas the devs have.

BUT and that is a huge but...

... I purchased this game like a trillion years ago and hoped for updates. But there are just minor ones like nothing happened.
I feel a bit ripped off, because in the state it is, it is not really playable. The AI is just dumb as hell and it gets really frustrating (the citizens are like lemmings).
And after a short time you have done everything there is to do. I'd say after a 100 minutes you have seen everything and it gets to the point where you are just tweaking your base or you are eager to fight the trials caused by bugs. I really tried to befriend with this game the way it is but it just gets worse, because the unfinished state and slow development starts to aggravate me more and more.

Also there are a lot of known bugs, but they fix them really late or never. Who knows? The devs prefer to remain silent about nearly everything. I just read something about “We’re nearing our goals and the complete state of the game is not far away”, so I decided to write this and warn everyone about this. The way it is, this game could be a free to play iPad thing. I'd pay about 4-7$ for this max, given that I wouldn't know what I know now.

For all the people, who think I'm just being pessimistic:
Look at their Website, or the updates here at Steam. It seems like they are releasing updates labeled as huge success, which are little more than some minor bug-fixes (or sometimes a bunch of new ones adding to the old ones).
And you can't know whats to come, because the devs decided to delete the Future developement plans"-website
date: which is a huge issue for me and just another indicator
recommended: that this game is dead and light years from being finished."
hoursPlayed: August 29, 2014

reviewText:
Early Access Review

UPDATE http://steamcommunity.com/gid/103582791434732506/announcements/detail/216494030200824180
Game is being pushed out the door half finished. DO NOT BUY. Most promised features never  materialized and game is shallow and broken as of 9/19/2014

Slow dev, NO communication now, and after nearly a year and maybe 5 updates a complete waste of your time, money, and sanity.

This game will never ship - it'll just drag on at a third of the pace of any other game (with a pro studio, I might add) while the devs make excuses like some kid who lost their homework.

I'm done screwing around with this - Doublefine may be a good studio but this team is a bunch of slow, excuse making hacks who are in absolutely no rush to make this game (and I suspect the money for it is going to other projects.)

Don't buy this game, even on sale. It's not worth it - there are MANY better Dwarf Fortress style games out there who's devs are actually engaged in their craft/jobs.

Doublefine screwed the pooch on this one, hard.
voteText: 1 person found this review helpful

reviewText:
Abandoned in early development.
Extremely sad state of affairs, as the concept was great, early alpha versions demonstrated a load of potential, but development has been killed off long before the game was properly fleshed out.  What you have is an abandoned skeleton which had great potential, but never got any real meat added to the bones.

DO NOT BUY
It's simply not worth the extremely high price asked for a forever-incomplete game which has very little substance in its current form.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Thought i'd love it, was correct...Just enough randomness to keep my attention. Can't wait to see finished product.

EDIT
I was cool with the bugs as it was in alpha. I was okay with the suffocating crew refusing to build more o2 recyclers...I was cool with the refinery breaking every 30 minutes (no not technician fix it broke) they forget how to use the reactor and go around dropping asteroid chunks on the ground broke...I was remotely cool with the raiders breaching my perfectly constructed ♥♥♥♥ every 2.4 minutes and walking through the hall with 4 turrets while brutally butchering my 6 person security detail with body armor and upgraded weapons... That was because it was in alpha...but now giving up and just dropping it...

NEVER AGAIN
